column2: WEST VIRGINIA DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: West Virginia
column6: WV

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Keeping your windows clean and clear.
column6: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.

column2: 2. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column4: Yield
column6: School crossing

column2: 3. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Stop.
column6: Wrong way.

column2: 4. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.
column6: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
column8: share the lane with the motorcycle.
column10: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.

column2: 5. This road sign:
column4: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column6: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column10: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.

column2: 6. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column6: stop doing what they are doing.
column8: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column10: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.

column2: 7. Drivers cannot pass safely unless:
column4: they can return to their lane before meeting oncoming vehicles.
column6: they can see far enough ahead.
column8: their vehicle is capable of the speed necessary to pass.

column2: 8. When changing lanes, you can check your blind spot by:
column4: using the inside rearview mirror.
column6: using the outside rearview mirror.
column8: turning your head and glancingÂ over your shoulder.
column10: checking the rearview and outside mirrors.

column2: 9. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column4: must not yield to
column6: must interrupt

column2: 10. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column6: Turn on your cruise control.
column8: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 11. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.
column6: look toward the left side of the road.
column8: look toward the right side of the road.
column10: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.

column2: 12. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column4: that a tire blowout is about to occur.
column6: of a headlight failure.

column2: 13. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column6: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column8: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.
column10: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.

column2: 14. A broken white line:
column4: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column6: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column8: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.

column2: 15. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column4: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.
column6: Never.

column2: 16. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
column4: Call the police.
column6: Do not panic.

column2: 17. A speed restriction sign:
column4: shows the recommended speed for a curve/turn.
column6: must be ignored in snow conditions.

column2: 18. If you stop along the road at night:
column4: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.
column6: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.

column2: 19. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: turn off the ignition.
column6: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column10: prepare to leave the lane safely.

column2: 20. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.
column6: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.

column2: 21. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.
column6: before you enter the intersection.
column8: only if the traffic signal turns red.

column2: 22. A driver approaching a flashing red traffic signal must:
column4: slow down at the traffic signal.
column6: merge to the left.
column10: carefully drive through the intersection without stopping.

column2: 23. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column4: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)
column6: Warning signs (diamond)

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column6: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column8: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.

column2: 25. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column6: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
